intro: Sticherus buchtienii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sticherus, is a small, perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Stichyaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces delicate, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
